title: The 10 best Fall festivals in Canada [Photos]
text:
The 10 best Fall festivals in Canada 
Postmedia Network Monday, October 12, 2015 06:00 AM MDT Top 10 Fall festivals in Canada 
From Oktoberfest in Kitchener,Ont. to the Fall Okanagan Wine Festival in B.C., we look at some of the best Fall festivals in Canada. (Handout/Postmedia Network) 
Oktoberfest, Kitchener-Waterloo, Ont.: 
The world's largest Oktoberfest celebrations outside Germany take place in these twin southwestern Ontario cities. Every October, revellers gather from near and far to bask in Bavarian culture, beer, traditional foods and fun activities for the family. 
(Courtesy Kitchener-Waterloo Oktoberfest) 
Niagara Wine Festival, Ont.: 
Niagara is home to some of the finest wines in our great country, and the Niagara Wine Festival is the perfect celebration of Niagara’s wine culture. It happens every September, with more than 100 events, including tours of wineries, tastings, concerts, local Niagara cuisine, wine seminars, and one of Canada’s largest street parades. It’s also a great way to welcome in winter. 
(Postmedia Network) 
Celtic Colours International Festival, Cape Breton Island, N.S.: 
This festival, now in its 15th year, attracts the world's best Celtic artists and performers, as well as thousands of tourists each year. Taking place in October, this year's festival will feature the Barra MacNeils, Ashley MacIssac and many more. 
(Courtesy Celtic Colours International Festival) 
Rocky Mountain Wine & Food Festival, Alta.: 
This food and wine event is renowned for the array of vendors it draws and the amazing selections of gourmet food, vino, beer and spirits guests can sample. The festival takes place in May in Banff and in October in Edmonton and Calgary. 
(Justin Parsons/Postmedia Network) 
Gatineau Hot Air Balloon Festival, Que.: 
Easily the most colourful fall festival in Canada, the Gatineau Hot Air Balloon Festival attracts thousands from all over to gaze at hot air balloons of every shape and colour. On top of the balloons, there are hundreds of live music acts and performances. 
(Darren Brown/Postmedia Network) 
Pumpkinfest, Wellington, Ont.: 
The town of Wellington, Ont. in Prince Edward County holds a legendary festival every October seeking the largest pumpkin in the area. Hundreds bring their largest pampered pumpkins every fall to try and win the sought after award. The festival also includes a parade, contests, local food, and many games. 
(Luke Hendry/Postmedia Network) 
Prince Edward Island International Shellfish Festival, P.E.I.: 
It’s called the “Biggest Kitchen Party in Atlantic Canada” for a reason. The PEI International Shellfish Festival showcases down-home Maritime hospitality with a tremendous array of delicious shellfish (make sure to try the lobster). 
(Tourism PEI/Barrett & MacKay) 
Nuit Blanche- Toronto, Ont.: 
Toronto's Nuit Blanche is a one night art event that brings thousands to the streets and squares of Canada's largest city. From 6:53 p.m. on Oct. 4 until sunrise the next day, art installations and performances take over city streets. Wander the streets and see things you'd never expect to see in the city. 
(Postmedia Network) 
Tremblant Symphony of Colours, Mont Tremblant, Que.: 
Mont Tremblant is bursting with tremendous autumn colours during the Tremblant Symphony of Colours. Right in the heart of the Laurentian Mountain region, and set amidst the beautiful fall foliage, the festival showcases concerts in the pedestrian village of Tremblant. Other activities to enjoy during the festival are hiking, fine dining, and shopping. 
(Postmedia Network) 
Fall Okanagan Wine Festival, B.C.: 
One of Canada's top wine regions, the Okanagan Valley, shines in fall during the Fall Okanagan Wine Festival. Taking place from Oct. 1 to 11, the fest includes 165 wine-related events and concerts. 
(Brian Sprout/Tourism Kelowna)
